result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Oates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Atty. Longacre was Court-appointed in this case.  The Defendant must repay Richland County, in full, for all costs of this Dean counsel.  The Court directs the Clerk of Court to use all measures statutorily available to collect this debt.  Once the amount of Atty. Longacre's bill is known, the clerk will communicate with the defendant the amount owed.
With huber.  Stayed until on or before Feb. 15, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Disposition of Warrant or Commitment - Time Served
for Compensation (submitted to Accts. Payable 2-26-16); reimbursement to def to be per this order as well as the Order Appointing Counsel of 2-18-15

Defendant Joseph M. Oates in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  15CM29 for plea/sentencing, 14TR597 for status, 14CM148 for status, and 14CT23 for status.  ADA states there are prosecutoral issues with this matter and is asking for jail sentence on dom. abuse related charge in 15CM29.  Court has stated at previous hearing and reiterates now its concerns over the proposed plea agreement.  Def addresses the Court.  Def pleads no contest to counts 2 and 3.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Court orders 30 days jail with costs.  Stayed until on or before 2/15 between 6-7 a.m.  Costs - 60 dtp.  Costs will include Dean counsel reimbursement.  Clerk to civil judgment and/or tax intercept if reimbursement not made.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Joseph M. Oates in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:  15CM29/plea and sentencing, and status in 14TR597, 14CM148, and 14CT23.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement to resolve all four cases.  Atty. L states that the def will be pleading to counts 2 and 3 of 15CM for dismissal/read-in of counts 1 and 4 in that case as well as 14Cm148 and 14CT23; 14TR597 to be dismissed; joint recommendation is for 30 days jail.

Court questions the 30 days jail recommendation; wonders why probation is not the recommended disposition.  DA Harper says this is ADA Forehand's case; the agreement of counsel was between she and Atty. Longacre.  Court informs the parties that he is not likely to follow the joint recommendation.

Atty. L asks for a reset to allow ADA Forehand opportunity to explain her position.  Court resets these matters to Jan. 13th at 9.
Rescheduled from 12/03/2015 to 12/18/2015 at request of DA office.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-18-2015 03:30 pm

15CM29, 14CT23,14CM148 called together. Defendant Joseph M. Oates in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. states def no longer qualifies for SPD representation, requests in 15CM29, def be appointed dean counsel. Def waives formal reading of the complaint, court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Court appoints Mr. Longacre. Matters will be reset.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
